metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1065 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel through 4.15.7 mishandles thecase of a rule blob that contains a jump but lacks a user-defined chain,which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointerdereference) by leveraging the CAP_NET_RAW or CAP_NET_ADMIN capability,related to arpt_do_table in net/ipv4/netfilter/arp_tables.c, ipt_do_tablein net/ipv4/netfilter/ip_tables.c, and ip6t_do_table innet/ipv6/netfilter/ip6_tables.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1022-aws - 4.4.0-1022.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-127.153~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1022.22').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
